Important Notice

November 2018

  • 11/16Azure Support Plan Notification

    We will be offering our new support plan from December 15. To deliver better experiences with Azure, we will continue to offer technical support services free-of-charge for enterprises. Customers who signed up for 21Vianet's Online Service Standard Agreement (OSSA) within the period of validity of your Azure agreement will get the “Developer” Support Plan. Customers who signed up for 21Vianet's Online Service Premier Agreement (OSPA) within the period of validity of your Azure agreement will get the “Standard” Support Plan. If you run business-critical workloads on Azure and would like to access services to satisfy the below needs, you may choose the paid “enterprise-tier” Premier Support Plan. Please contact your account manager for more details concerning purchase and use of “enterprise-tier” support plans.

    • Designated service delivery manager committed to improve your Azure experience.
    • Highest priority reactive support to help ensure business continuity of your services.

    Please clickhere for more details of support plans.

    In addition, adjusted phone service hours are from 9am to 9pm, Monday-Sunday. For frequently asked questions on Azure, we recommend you get answers to your questions fast through Online Customer Service or WeChat Official Accounts (Azure Cloud Technical Support).

October 2018

  • October 31We have updated our Privacy Statement for Online Services

    Your privacy is of critical importance to us. We strive to protect your personal information. Therefore, we have updated our Privacy Statement and would like to share the updates with you. The updates takes effect as from today.

    In particular, we have combined the Privacy Statements of Azure and Office 365 and made adjustments as shown below:

    1. Enhanced your rights to your personal information

    • Further strengthened your control over your personal information, including your right to know, right to choose, right of revocation and right to amend.
    • Clarified the principles such as storage constraints so as to ensure information will be deleted immediately following the end of the lifecycle or your personal information will be anonymized and etc.
    • Introduced our protection mechanism for your personal information, including protection for the personal information of minors.
    • Clarified that we would obtain your consent in advance with regards to the use of your personal information for purposes not covered by this privacy policy.

    2. A more transparent approach in introducing how your personal data would be processed

    • Clarified the boundaries of “personal information” and “sensitive personal information” and explained to you the scenarios that might involve “personal information” when 21Vianet Online Services collects and uses your information.
    • Covered a series of scenarios with regards to our collection of personal information. For example, we would collect your personal information through the process of real-name authentication when you use 21Vianet Online Services. In addition, we would also collect your personal information through websites and marketing activities.
    • Introduced how we would share your personal information, including sharing with external subjects.

    We encourage you to read the full Privacy Statement and understand the updates we made. If you have any questions or thoughts, please contact us through Azure support.

    Readfull Privacy Statement.

August 2018

  • Risk Warning: Linux denial of service vulnerability

    8/15: Another security vulnerability called “FragmentSmack” (CVE-2018-5391) also leads to denial of service (DoS) of Linux operating system. We have taken proper protective measures to ensure Microsoft cloud platform’s customers (Azure and Microsoft 365) free from the affection of this vulnerability. You do not need to take any immediate protective actions. However, as a best practice, we still recommend that you regularly consult each Linux distribution provider to install the latest updates for Linux Virtual Machines running on the Azure platform. You can consult each Linux distribution provider for more information on Linux security vulnerabilities.

    8/7: We noticed that a newly disclosed security vulnerability (CVE-2018-5390) may cause the Linux operating system to temporarily fall into a “Denial of Service (DoS)” state. Virtual Machines running the Linux operating system may be vulnerable to this attack, but Azure hosting platform will not be affected. We are currently working with numerous Linux distribution providers to help them address this security issue. Please contact each Linux distribution provider for guidance on how to address the CVE-2018-5390 security vulnerability. For more information on this vulnerability, please visit the Vulnerability Notes Database at https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/962459.

    We will continue to update this security notice as the case progresses.

July 2018

  • 7/16PHP minor version + Xdebug update notifications

    In August 2018, Azure App Services will stack update PHP to the latest version. For information about changes in the latest version, please see the change logs on the PHP website.

    PHP Versions Change Logs

    For more information about how to use the right version of Xdebug for your version of PHP, see the Xdebug Blog.

June 2018

  • 6/27 Azure new data centers (regions) have officially opened

    Two new data centers for Microsoft Azure operated by 21Vianet (located in two new regions) have officially opened: China East 2 and China North 2. Both new and existing customers are free to use the new data center resources. As the first international public cloud technology platform to operate commercially in China, we have not only tripled the number of data centers that we operate, but also accelerated the deployment of the latest Azure services, to provide the China market with a diverse range of virtual machines instances, faster data processing capabilities, more advanced AI (artificial intelligence), more data connection options, and more convenient and efficient PaaS (Platform as a Service) services. For details, visit the blog entry New China Azure data centers (regions) are officially launched.

March 2018

  • 3/20 Please update Azure Site Recovery, which uses Access Control authentication before March 31, 2018.

    Azure Site Recovery helps to coordinate replication and protects running workloads. Access Control authentication services used by older versions of the Site Recovery Provider (also known as DRA) and Recovery Service (also known as MARS) agents are about to be retired. To avoid interruptions, please update these older versions before March 31, 2018.

    Earlier versions of DRA agents (before 5.1.2700) and MARS agents (before 2.0.9096) rely on access control service capabilities for authentication, but this service plan will be completely retired in April 2018. Newer versions of DRA agents (5.1.2700 or later) and MARS agents (2.0.9096 or later) use the latest Azure Active Directory authentication mechanism, which includes role-based control and finer access capabilities. Users who are still using DRA versions before 5.1.2700 and/or MARS agents before 2.0.9096 and replicating servers to one or more recovery service vaults are requested to update your old version to continue using the Site Recovery Service and its upcoming features. If you have already performed these updates, no additional action is required. The new version relies on Azure Active Directory instead of Access Control.

    We recommend that you update DRA instances to version 5.1.2700 or later and MARS agents to version 2.0.9096 or later before March 31, 2018. Please complete all updates by this date to prevent the failure of replication and failover configurations in Azure Site Recovery.

    You can perform updates on the Azure portal:

    1. Sign in to the Azure portal.
    2. Open the Recovery Services Vault menu item.
    3. Select the banner that prompts this update to see the remaining steps.
    4. Follow these steps to update the Site Recovery Provider and MARS agent to the latest version on the server.
    5. To complete this process and update the authentication service, please select Update Authentication Service on the Registered Servers page in the portal.

    For more information, please read these detailed steps.

    If you have any questions, you can get support via the following options:

    • Click on the Azure portal’s Help and Support page for technical support.
    • Create a work order online.
    • Call the 21Vianet technical support hotline: 400-089-0365.

January 2018

  • January 6 Protecting Azure Clients from the Threat of CPU Security Vulnerabilities

    An update to repair a CPU hardware-based security vulnerability of extensive impact has been completely deployed in all regions across China. The Azure infrastructure has been updated on the virtualization engine level this time. We advise you to continue to use best security practices when it comes to Virtual Machine imaging. Maintaining the security of our users is always our primary mission. Thank you very much for your understanding and cooperation during this update.

    For more information, please visit Azure’s blog articles.

Product Update

Expand All

November 2018

  • 11/22Azure SQL Database Single DB Gen5 using vCore-based purchasing model has been announced for China East 2 and China North 2 datacenters

    Azure SQL database is a fully managed relational database with built-in intelligence supporting self-driving features, such as performance tuning and threat alerts. Microsoft performs all the patching and updating of the code base, and manages the underlying infrastructure for you, so you can save time and resources.With high SQL Server compatibility, you can also migrate your databases to SQL Database Managed Instance without changing your apps.

    If flexible, controllable, and transparent independent resource usage is required, a vCore-based purchasing model is most suitable. This model allows calculation scaling, memory, and storage based on workload requirements and provides a direct way to translate local workload requirements into the cloud. The single DB Gen5 platform has been announced for China East 2 and China North 2 datacenters.

    To understand more about pricing for this service, please visit Azure SQL Database pricing details page. For more details please visit Azure SQL Database Documentation page.

  • 11/20Azure Standard Load Balancer announced

    Standard Load Balancer supports inbound as well as outbound scenarios, provides low latency and high throughput, and scales up to millions of flows for all TCP and UDP applications. You can use load balancing rules with TCP/HTTP/HTTPS health probes, inbound NAT rules for port forwarding, and outbound rules to scale and tune your outbound connectivity.

    For more information about Standard Load Balancer and its pricing, see Standard Load Balancer overview page and Standard Load Balancer Pricing Details page. For more details, please visit the Standard Load Balancer Documentation page.

  • 11/12 Azure HDInsight Linux is now officially released in China North 2 data center

    Azure HDInsight is a fully-managed cloud service that makes it easy, fast, and cost-effective to process massive amounts of data. Use popular open-source frameworks such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive, LLAP, Kafka, Storm, HBase and more. Azure HDInsight enables a broad range of scenarios such as ETL, Data Warehousing, IoT and more.

    Azure HDInsight Linux is now officially released in China North 2 data center. To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure HDInsight Services Feature page and Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure HDInsight Document page.

  • November 1Azure Customer Engagement Fabric preview version announced

    Customer Engagement Fabric preview version is announced. Customer Engagement Fabric (CEF) provides a series of basic services that allow interactive connectivity between the app and users, including multi-channel notification service, third-party sign-in and aggregate functions for payment. These services can help the app quickly implement relevant user connectivity functions, improve user engagement and analyze user behavior data to improve app operational efficiency.

    Services formally announced in the preview version include:

    1. Text message notification: provide stable and highly efficient text message services, support text message with verification code, text message notification and marketing text message for members.

    2. Third-party sign-in: Provides unified SDK to help developers implement WeChat, QQ, Weibo Sign-in to implement unified data management.

    To understand more about this service, please visit Customer Engagement Fabric Product Functionpage and Pricingpage. For more details, please visit Customer Engagement Fabric documentationpage. For more information about this announcement, please refer to blogCustomer Engagement Fabric preview version announcement.

October 2018

  • 10/24China regions cloud migration and expansion preview now available

    China regions cloud migration and expansion provides customers with assessment services and migration guidance to reduce instances from arising based on the below two scenarios:

    1. For customers migrating your Azure Cloud Services among China regions, please visit http://aka.ms/ccmechina;

    2. For customers migrating and expanding your Azure Cloud Services between Azure Global and Azure China, please visit http://aka.ms/ccme.

    This product has two components:

    Online assessment service can assess consistency of services and configurations between original and destination environments, as well as estimate the migration costs. Customers can conduct this assessment through subscription and/or Azure usage reports.

    This migration guide has undergone verification tests by engineers. It provides step-by-step video guides on migrating main workloads. Main workloads include Virtual Machines, Storage, Virtual Network, Database, Web Apps and Azure Cosmos DB.

  • 10/15Release of Azure Logic Apps Preview

    Logic Apps helps you to quickly generate powerful integration solutions, connecting business-critical apps and services and automating workflows without writing any codes. You can connect apps, data, and devices anywhere - locally or in the cloud - with our large ecosystem of software as a service (SaaS) and cloud-based connectors that includes Salesforce, Office 365, Twitter, Dropbox, Google services, and more.

    To learn more about this capability and pricing, please visit the Logic Apps Feature page and the Logic Apps Pricingpage. For more details, please visit the Azure Logic Apps page.

  • October 15Azure online customer support preview version announced

    Effective immediately, you can quickly get answers to the FAQs while using Azure through two channels without the need to wait.

    • Login to Azure Support Submission Page, click on “Online Customer Support”at the lower right corner

    • Follow “Microsoft cloud technologies” WeChat Official Accounts, click on the menu experience cloud - intelligent customer support (preview version) (note: WeChat channel provides only intelligent customer support at the moment)

    Azure intelligent customer support “Cloud” uses Azure Cognitive Services, Azure Cosmos DB and machine learning, as well as supporting data and technical knowledge base to help customers get answers to relevant Azure questions. At the same time, through continuing training of machine learning, intelligent customer support can self-evolve as time progresses, giving ever more accurate answers. Users can choose a human operator online on top of the intelligent customer support, which allows users to engage engineers in the same chat. With this “online customer support” model, we hope to provide you with a faster, easier and more intelligent Azure support experience.

September 2018

  • September 28Azure Stream Analytics on IoT Edge preview version released

    Azure Stream Analytics on Azure IoT Edge enables developers to deploy near-real-time analytical intelligence closer to IoT devices so that they can unlock the full value of device-generated data. Azure Stream Analytics is designed for low latency, resiliency, efficient use of bandwidth, and compliance. Enterprises can now deploy control logic close to industrial operations and complement big data analytics performed in the cloud. For more information on this feature and its pricing, please visit the Azure Stream Analytics Pricing Page. Please see this documentation for more details.

  • September 18Azure Backup is officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers

    Azure Backup is a reliable, low-cost, and scalable solution, allowing for backup of local data onto the cloud. Without any capital investment, you can protect your key business data with the lowest operating expenses.

    Azure Backup now enables backup of virtual machines on Azure through a few simple steps, and also permits placing the restore points on the cloud storage. Whenever necessary, you can respond from the restore points to meet various demands for protecting Azure Virtual Machines.

    The Azure Backup is now officially released in the new data centers (China East 2 and China North 2). To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure Backup Service Feature page and Price Details page. For more details, please visit Azure Backup Document page.

  • September 18 Azure Site Recovery is officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers

    Azure Site Recovery can help protect your major services by coordinating automatic copying and recovery of the private cloud at auxiliary positions. There are two major deployment choices.

    • The Virtual Machine operated while Hyper-V and system center are used can be copied between two client sites. Azure Site Recovery can monitor the status and storage recovery plan of the application programs operated at home sites and execute the plan when necessary. When site interruptions happen at the main data center, Virtual Machine recovers as arranged so as to help rapidly recover services. This process can also be used for recovery tests or temporary transmission services.
    • Now, Virtual Machine can be copied directly from a home site to Azure instead of your own auxiliary site. When home site interrupt happens, this service can coordinate the recovery of Virtual Machine in Azure.

    The Azure Site Recovery is now officially released in the new data centers (China East 2 and China North 2). To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure Site Recovery Services Feature page and Price Details page.For more details, please visit Azure Site Recovery Document page.

  • September 17Azure Resource Manager Management Groups Feature is officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers

    Management Groups is a feature of the Azure Resource Manager (ARM) service. If your organization has many subscriptions, you may need a way to effectively manage the access, policy, and compliance for those subscriptions. Azure Management Groups provide a higher level of coverage than subscriptions. You organize subscriptions in a container called a "Management Group" and apply your management conditions to the Management Group. All subscriptions in the Management Group automatically inherit these conditions. Regardless of the type of subscription you use, the management team can provide you with large-scale enterprise-level management. For more details, please visit Management Group Documentation.

  • September 13Azure Automation is officially released in China North 2 data center

    Azure Automation provides cloud-based automation and configuration services which allow for consistent management in both Azure and non-Azure environments. Functions include process automation, update management, and configuration. Azure Automation provides full control during the deployment, operation, and shutdown of workloads and resources. Azure Automation has now officially been released in the China North 2 data center. To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure Automation Service Feature Page and Price Details Page. For more details, please visit Azure Automation Documentation Page.

  • September 10 Azure Batch is officially released in China East 2 and China North 2 data centers

    Using Azure Batch allows users to efficiently run massively parallel and high performance computing (HPC) batch jobs in Azure. Users can use the Batch scheduling function for free, paying only for the underlying virtual machine service consumption. There is no additional cost for using Azure Batch. Developers use Azure Batch to extend parallel workloads, manage the execution of tasks in queues, and offload computing jobs in the cloud through applications. By using Azure Batch, users can run these applications on demand or on a large scale without having to create and manage clusters, virtual machines, or job plans. Azure Batch can manage virtual machine deployment, autoscaling, and failback; be used as a part of your workflow; and deliver applications as a service.

    Azure Batch has now officially been released in the new data centers (China East 2 and China North 2). To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit Azure Batch Service Feature Page and Price Details Page.For more details, please visit Azure Batch Documentation Page.

August 2018

  • August 22 Azure Container Registry preview version released

    Azure Container Registry preview version has been released in China. It provides a hosted Docker registration service for storing and managing private container images. Azure Container Registry can work along with the existing container development and deployment channels. You can generate a container image in Azure using the Azure Container Registry Build. The source code submission and base image update can be used to generate triggers on demand as needed or fully automatically.

    To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit the Container Registry Service Feature page and the Container Registry Price Detailspage. For more details, please visit the Azure Container Registry Documentation page.

July 2018

  • July 23 Azure Database for MySQL and Azure Database for PostgreSQL officially released

    Azure Database for MySQL and Azure Database for PostgreSQL have now been officially released. They offer Azure Community edition MySQL and PostgreSQL database engines, built-in high availability, elastic scale for performance, as well as industry-leading security and compliance with 99.99% SLA. They also deliver flexibility for your applications. From framework and language of your choice to a rich tools and service ecosystem, thereby enabling you to build intelligent applications faster and with greater ease.

    To learn more about Azure Database for MySQL and its pricing details, please visit Azure Database for MySQL Service Features page and Azure Database for MySQL Pricing Details page. To learn more about Azure Database for PostgreSQL and its pricing details, please visit Azure Database for PostgreSQL Service Features page and Azure Database for PostgreSQL Pricing Details page.

  • July 2 Azure SQL Database Standard Performance Tiers S4, S6, S7, S9, and S12 are officially released

    Azure SQL Database is a managed intelligent relational cloud database service. Using existing SQL Server functions, you can migrate SQL Server databases, speed up app development, and simplify maintenance without changing your app. New performance tiers (S4, S6, S7, S9, and S12) for single databases within SQL database have been officially launched. They provide more CPUs for standard databases, so that you can obtain a significant number of CPUs without having to use the Premium version, thereby reducing costs.

    For more information about this service and pricing, please visit the SQL Database Service Features page and the SQL Database Pricing Details page.

June 2018

  • 6/25Official Release of Azure Policy

    Azure Policy is a new service that allows customers to assess and implement management standards on the enterprise scale throughout the entire Azure environment, and achieve appropriate control and compatibility. Azure Policy can evaluate Azure resources that breach policies and run compliance audits for every policy in a subscription. The goal of Azure Policy is to manage the largest possible Azure environment, in order to provide consistent standards for all of a department or company’s Azure subscriptions.

    For more information about this service, visit the Azure Policy Service Functions page. For more detailed information, visit the Azure Policy Documents page.

  • June 11Azure Advisor preview version released

    The preview version of Azure Advisor has been released in China. Azure Advisor is a free product that helps you to optimize Azure deployment to follow best practices. It analyzes your resource configuration and usage telemetry, and then recommends solutions that help you to increase resource cost-effectiveness, performance, and availability. Azure Advisor allows you to obtain the following workable recommendations:

    • High availability: Safeguards and improves the continuity of business-critical apps;
    • Performance: Increases the speed of apps;
    • Cost: Optimizes and reduces overall Azure expenditure.

    For more information about this service, visit the Azure Advisor Service Functions page. For more detailed information, visit the Azure Advisor Documents page.

  • 1 June Azure Media Services Premium encoder will be officially released

    In addition to supporting 4K AVC, multiple language audio, hidden captions, deinterlacing, and color changes, Azure Media Services Premium Encoder still provides new Premium Encoder features, including support for MXF and DVCPRO formats. These features can be accessed through the Azure Media Services Explorer desktop tool.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit the Media Services Functions and Pricing Details for Media Services web pages.

May 2018

  • May 15Azure IoT Hub Basic tier officially released

    Azure IoT Hub Basic tier is now officially released. It is only suitable for simple (from the device to the cloud) IoT solutions, and this Basic tier has a better price than the Standard tier. Each IoT Hub tier provides three sizes, dependent on daily capacity for data throughput. These sizes are labeled 1, 2, or 3. Grade 1 can handle 400,000 messages per unit per day. Grade 3 can handle 300 million messages per unit per day. After an IoT Hub is created, you can upgrade from the Basic tier to the Standard tier with no interruption in operations.

    For more information on services and pricing, please consult the Azure IoT Hub Service Features page and the Azure IoT Hub Pricing Details page. To better understand which IoT tier is appropriate, refer to the document Selecting a suitable IoT Hub solution tier.

  • May 10Azure Functions managed in the App Service Plan is officially launched

    We are very happy to announce the official release in China of Azure Functions managed in the App Service Plan. Azure Functions allows you to run code on demand, without configuring or managing infrastructure. Using Azure Functions, you can:

    • easily build the apps you need using simple, serverless functions;
    • manage your apps without infrastructure;
    • only compile code that is genuinely important to your business;
    • use your programming language of choice to create functions.

    An enriched portal experience allows you to create, manage, and monitor your functions. You can use C#, F#, or JavaScript to develop, and you can use triggers or binding to integrate with various types of services. Deploy apps to Azure as before, selecting from a series of tools, for example cross-platform CLI, Visual Studio IDE and VS Code for local development, debugging, and testing.

    Currently, Azure Functions can only be managed in an App Service Plan and billed using an App Service billing model. Each plan requires you to choose the region, the actual quantity of VM in the region, and the size of VM needed for a dedicated application. If you have a consumption plan, please consult with your customer manager.

    For more information on this service and pricing, visit the Azure Functions Service Features page and the Azure Functions pricing details page. For even more details, visit the Azure Functions documentation page.

  • May 10 Azure Storage General Purpose v2 storage account was officially released

    Azure Storage Service General Purpose v2 (GPv2) is a new kind of Azure Storage account:

    • it supports Tiered Storage;
    • helps manage the cost of expanded storage requirements;
    • and allows you to use Tiered Storage to organize data according to properties such as access frequency and planned retention period.

    Azure currently provides three kinds of storage accounts: General Purpose v2, General Purpose v1, and Blob Storage. Storage accounts determine eligibility for specific storage services and features, and each storage account is priced differently. We suggest you carefully consult the price models to determine which is most suitable. Depending on the account type you are using, the differences between some workloads might be quite large. We generally recommend new customers use General Purpose v2 to access the newest file storage features, including Tiered Storage and Archive. We only recommend that experienced customers use General Purpose v1 and Blob Storage accounts, but these customers can also benefit from the use of GPv2.

    To learn more about the advantages of the different Storage accounts, visit this documentation; to learn about Tiered Storage, visit this documentation.

  • 5/4Azure SQL Database released a new purchasing model (preview)

    We are very happy to announce that a new purchasing model has been released for Azure SQL Database elastic pools and single databases - a vCore-based purchasing model (preview). The new model is different from the existing DTU-based model and is designed to give you flexibility, control, transparency, and an easier way to compare to on-premises workloads. It allows you to scale compute, storage, and IO independently based upon your workload needs. The vCore model is also eligible for savings of up to 30% with Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server.

    For more information on pricing, please visit the SQL Database Pricing Details page. To learn more about Azure Hybrid Benefit, please visit the Azure Hybrid Benefit page. For more information on this service and how these features are deployed, please visit the SQL Database Service Features page and the SQL Database Documentation page.

  • May 3 Preview version of Azure SQL Database long-term retention released

    With the long-term retention feature, SQL Database backups can be stored in Azure Recovery Services vaults for up to 10 years. Each vault can store up to 1,000 databases. You can then select any backup in your vault and restore it as a new database. You can use long-term backup retention to associate SQL Database servers with Azure Recovery Services vaults.

    • You must create a vault within the same geographical region and resource group in the Azure subscription that the SQL Server was created with.
    • Configure retention policies for any database. When you use these policies, weekly full database backups will be copied to the Recovery Services vault, and this data will be preserved for the specified retention period (up to 10 years).
    • A database can be restored from any of these backups to a new database on any server within the subscription. Azure Storage creates a replica from an existing backup, this replica will not affect the performance of the existing database.

    For details on pricing, please visit the SQL Database Pricing Details page. For more information on this service and how these features are deployed, please visit the SQL Database Service Features page and the SQL Database Documentation page.

  • May 2 Azure Service Bus to be billed by the hour

    Azure Service Bus can connect your customers' existing on-premises systems to cloud solutions, distribute messages to multiple independent back-end systems, and simplify enterprise integration with reliable cloud messaging.

    From May 2, 2018, Service Bus standard units will be billed by the hour, replacing the current daily and hourly billing to be more consistent with other Azure services. Customers will only be required to pay for the hours spent using Service Bus, instead of for an entire day or month. All Service Bus customers will be migrated to the new resource GUID. This change will have no effect on pricing.

    To learn more about this service and its pricing, please visit the Service Bus Service Features page and the Service Bus Pricing Details page.

  • May 2 Azure API Management officially released

    We are pleased to announce that Azure API Management has now been officially released in China. Azure API Management is a suite of full life-cycle solutions released to both internal and external customers. Customers can use API Management to rapidly create a consistent, modern API gateway for existing back-end services hosted in any location, helping them to prevent abuse and overuse, and get insights into usage and health.

    The major application scenarios for using Azure API Management include:

    • Using APIs internally and externally to help enterprises implement digital transformation, and increase efficiency and agility.
    • Opening up core business services or data to business partners and the public to increase market share.
    • Safely opening up key system functions for mobile and web applications, supporting new user experiences, and attracting more customers.

    APIs are no longer technology assets but drivers of new business models, digital strategies, and ecosystems. To learn more about this service and its pricing, visit the API Management Service Features page and the API Management Pricing Details page.

April 2018

  • April 27 Notice on price reductions for Standard version of Azure IoT Hub

    There are four editions of Azure IoT Hub: Free, S1, S2, and S3.

    Free Edition: free trial of Azure IoT Hub services. Upon sign up, you can transmit up to 8,000 messages per day. It is suitable for understanding and testing features of IoT Hub Services.

    S1 Edition: the IoT Hub S1 edition is designed for IoT solutions that generate relatively small amounts of data. Each pricing unit of the S1 Edition allows you to transfer up to 400,000 million messages per day across all connected devices.

    S2 Edition: the IoT Hub S2 Edition is designed for IoT solutions that generate relatively large amounts of data. Each pricing unit of the S2 Edition allows you to transfer up to 6 million messages per day across all connected devices.

    S3 Edition: The IoT Hub S3 Edition is designed for IoT solutions that generate extra large amounts of data. Each S3 Edition pricing unit allows you to transfer up to 300 million messages per day across all connected devices.
